('Equation', ma_ghf - 105, (88, 89, 90,: Step 5: <because> the incenter of △ EFG is H, <therefore> EH is the besector line of ∠ GEF, GH besects ∠ FGE, FH is the besector line of ∠ EFG, $ ∠ GEF = 2*∠ HEF $, $ ∠ GEF = 2*∠ GEH $, $ ∠ FGE = 2*∠ HGE $, $ ∠ FGE = 2*∠ FGH $, ∠ FGH = ∠ HGE, $ ∠ EFG = 2*∠ HFG $, $ ∠ EFG = 2*∠ EFH $, ∠ EFH = ∠ HFG.
Step 6: <by> solve_eq, <because> $ ∠ GEF = 2*∠ HEF $ from step 5, ∠ GEF = 30°, <therefore> ∠ HEF = 15°.
Step 7: <by> solve_eq, <because> $ ∠ GEF = 2*∠ GEH $ from step 5, ∠ GEF = 30°, <therefore> ∠ GEH = 15°.

Step 8: <by> solve_eq, <because> ∠ EFH = ∠ HFG from step 5, $ ∠ EFG = 2*∠ EFH $ from step 5, $ ∠ EFG = 2*∠ HFG $ from step 5, ∠ FGH = ∠ HGE from step 5, $ ∠ FGE = 2*∠ FGH $ from step 5, $ ∠ FGE = 2*∠ HGE $ from step 5, ∠ GEF = 30°, ∠ GEH = 15° from step 7, ∠ HEF = 15° from step 6, $ ∠ EFG + ∠ FGE + ∠ GEF = 180 $ from step 4, $ ∠ EFH + ∠ FHE + ∠ HEF = 180 $ from step 3, $ ∠ EHG + ∠ GEH + ∠ HGE = 180 $ from step 2, $ ∠ FGH + ∠ GHF + ∠ HFG = 180 $ from step 1, <therefore> ∠ GHF = 105°.
